displaytitle: Oh!... absolument!  comme si on y était ... (Oh! Absolutely, as if one were there)
medium: Lithograph with hand-coloring and highlights in gum
creditline: Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund
markings: Stamp in purple ink, lower right corner
inscribed:
Titled above stone, center: TYPES PARISIENS.

Initialed in stone, lower center: h.D.

Printed below stone, from left to right: Chez Bauger R. du Croissant 16. / Chez Aubert gal. Véro-Dodat. / Imp. d’Aubert & Cie.

Captioned below stone, center: Oh!.. absolument comme si on y était; la grande òte son corset, et la petite cherche une puce.

titles.title: Oh!... absolument!  comme si on y était ... (Oh! Absolutely, as if one were there)

makers.displaydate: 1808–1879; born Valmondois, France; died Marseille, France
makers.displaymaker: Honoré Daumier, 1808–1879; born Valmondois, France; died Marseille, France
Printed and published by Aubert, French, active 1829–1847
Published by Bauger et Cie, French, active 1830–1842

texts.textentryhtml: Relaxation of French press-censorship laws in 1830 gave rise to a number of populist newspapers that combined journalism with the art of caricature. For nearly thirty years, Daumier regularly supplied lithographs to these publications, including this droll image of two men with a telescope, spying on women in a neighboring apartment. First published in the newspaper Le Figaro on July 30, 1840, this impression was printed on quality paper and colored by hand as part of a deluxe set of Daumier’s series Types Parisiens, satirizing the foibles of the Parisian petite bourgeoisie.

bibliography.boilertext: Loys Delteil, "Volume 21," Le peintre-graveur illustré (Paris: Chez l'Auteur, 1906-1930).
